answers.answer: Hi,I understand your concern regarding this incident in your lab. Can you elaborate on the injury- how deep was the puncture or was it just an abrasion from the needle? There are a lot of factors to consider in evaluating the risk such as your medical history, the cell line used,  age, gender, race, family history or presence of other underlying conditions such as diabetes. You may benefit from direct evaluation by your doctor as well as  diagnostic tests to help with the evaluation. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: I am a researcher currently working on pancreatic cancer. While I was injecting a mouse with a suspension of pancreatic cancer cell line(originating from mice), I accidentally injured my abdomen (subcutaneous tissue) with the needle. The mice we use are sterile, but will by any chance i may be at risk? can those cancer cells drived from mice grow into humans? If the cell line was from humans, would it be a risk? Should i do anything? I am otherwise healthy.
title: Occupational health
